newsitem.title: USA: Jackie O's childhood farm up for sale.
newsitem.headline: Jackie O's childhood farm up for sale.

text.p: For all those who missed the auction, another property associated with Jacqueline Kennedy Onassis is on the block. Price tag -- $7.95 million.

The oceanfront Newport, Rhode Island farm where Onassis spent her summers as a teen-ager, site of the wedding reception when she married John F. Kennedy, has recently received several firm offers, a realtor said on Friday.

"It's been up (for sale) for about a year and two or three months. We've got one offer right now that is receiving consideration and we expect a few other offers coming in," said Neal Balboni, listing agent for Natick, Massachusetts-based Burr Associates.
The 48-acre (19.4 hectare) Hammersmith Farm, formerly owned by Onassis' step-father Hugh Auchincloss, is "a classic, turn-of-the-century, shingle-style home," Balboni said.

The farm, with a 28-room summer house, stables, and a children's playhouse now run as a shop, is owned by a group of Massachusetts business people. It is open to the public as a tourist site and hosts about 100,000 visitors annually.

Most of the contents of the house are included in the price but few belonged to Onassis, who died in 1994. A Sotheby's auction of her belongings in April, called the celebrity sale of the century, raised $34.5 million as her admirers paid thousands for everything from pillows, books and furniture to fake and valuable jewelery.
